subject: Real Estate
title: How Interest Rates Move Home Prices
description: A short lesson to help you apply How Interest Rates Move Home Prices.

hook.text: When the Federal Reserve cuts rates by 1%, the average buyer can suddenly afford 10% more house.

buildup.text: Lower rates mean lower monthly payments, which increases the pool of eligible borrowers.

discovery.text: More buyers competing for the same homes push prices up â€” the rate cut feeds directly into values.

twist.text: When rates rise, the process reverses. Buyers vanish, prices stall, and sellers get stuck.

climax.text: Interest rates are the invisible lever that moves trillions of dollars in housing wealth.

punchline.text: The Fed moves a number. Millions of home prices follow.

quiz.question: How do lower interest rates affect home prices?
options: They push prices up by increasing buyer purchasing power
